title: Jejuri Khandoba Temple
subtitle: The Golden Hill Shrine of Lord Khandoba — Guardian Deity of Maharashtra
overview: Jejuri, located near Pune, is one of the most famous pilgrimage centers in Maharashtra dedicated to Lord Khandoba, an incarnation of Lord Shiva. The temple, perched atop a hill, offers panoramic views of the surrounding region and holds immense cultural and spiritual significance.

The site is known for its golden hues — the air filled with turmeric powder, symbolizing prosperity and auspiciousness. Pilgrims climb nearly 200 stone steps to reach the temple, chanting 'Yelkot Yelkot Jai Malhar!' along the way.

highlights.title: Khandoba Temple
highlights.description: An ancient hilltop shrine devoted to Lord Khandoba, also known as Malhari Martand, worshipped as the guardian deity of Maharashtra.

highlights.title: Golden Turmeric Festival
highlights.description: During Bhandara Festival, devotees throw turmeric in the air, turning the entire temple and hillside golden.

geography.intro: Jejuri is situated about 50 km southeast of Pune city, on the banks of the Karha River in Purandar taluka.

climate.description: Jejuri has a semi-arid climate with hot summers and mild winters. The best time to visit is during winter and major festivals.

geography.conclusion: Jejuri is best visited during the Bhandara Festival or winter months when the temple’s spiritual ambiance is at its peak.

activities.title: Climb the Hill Steps
activities.description: Devotees climb nearly 200 steps to reach the temple, enjoying scenic views and chanting prayers.
info: Steps lined with small shrines and idols.
Vendors sell turmeric, coconuts, and offerings along the way.

activities.title: Bhandara Festival
activities.description: Celebrate Jejuri’s iconic festival where clouds of turmeric turn the temple golden.

activities.title: Khandoba Pooja
activities.description: Perform ritual offerings and witness traditional 'arti' ceremonies dedicated to Lord Khandoba.
info: Offer turmeric, flowers, and jaggery to the deity.
Aarti timings: Morning 6 AM, Evening 7 PM.

attractions.title: Main Khandoba Temple
attractions.description: A grand temple built with yellow basalt stone, featuring exquisite carvings and a tall Dipmal (lamp tower).

attractions.title: Deepmal (Lamp Tower)
attractions.description: A magnificent stone lamp tower lit during special occasions, illuminating the entire temple hill.

attractions.title: Karha River Ghats
attractions.description: Sacred riverbank where devotees perform ritual baths before visiting the temple.

marineLife.intro: Though Jejuri is not coastal, its spiritual aura symbolizes Maharashtra’s deep-rooted cultural and divine life force.

items.title: Faith and Devotion
items.description: The temple celebrates devotion, discipline, and the victory of good over evil.

items.title: Symbol of Prosperity
items.description: The turmeric used in rituals symbolizes purity, wealth, and spiritual energy.

conclusion: Jejuri is a radiant symbol of faith and heritage.
Its golden aura continues to bless devotees across generations.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Regular buses and private vehicles connect Jejuri with Pune, Baramati, and Satara.
The temple hill is a short walk from Jejuri town.

howToReach.title: By Rail & Air
details: Jejuri has its own railway station with direct trains from Pune and Daund.
Pune Airport is the nearest air connection, about 52 km away.

bookingTips.description: Plan visits early in the morning to avoid crowds during weekends and festivals.
Carry turmeric packets carefully — avoid opening during travel to prevent staining.
Photography is allowed outside the sanctum but avoid flash inside the temple.
